1.text: Every wise woman buildeth her house: but the foolish plucketh it down with her own hands.

2.text: He that walketh in his uprightness feareth the LORD: but he that is perverse in his ways despiseth him.

3.text: In the mouth of the foolish is a rod of pride: but the lips of the wise shall preserve them.

4.text: Where no oxen are, the crib is clean: but much increase is by the strength of the ox.

5.text: A faithful witness will not lie: but a false witness uttereth lies.

6.text: A scorner seeketh wisdom, and findeth it not: but knowledge is easy unto him that hath understanding.

7.text: Go into the presence of a foolish man, and thou shalt not perceive in him the lips of knowledge.

8.text: The wisdom of the prudent is to understand his way: but the folly of fools is deceit.

9.text: The foolish make a mock at guilt: but among the upright there is good will.

10.text: The heart knoweth its own bitterness; and a stranger doth not intermeddle with its joy.

11.text: The house of the wicked shall be overthrown: but the tent of the upright shall flourish.

12.text: There is a way which seemeth right unto a man, but the end thereof are the ways of death.

13.text: Even in laughter the heart is sorrowful; and the end of mirth is heaviness.

14.text: The backslider in heart shall be filled with his own ways: and a good man shall be satisfied from himself.

15.text: The simple believeth every word: but the prudent man looketh well to his going.

16.text: A wise man feareth, and departeth from evil: but the fool beareth himself insolently, and is confident.

17.text: He that is soon angry will deal foolishly: and a man of wicked devices is hated.

18.text: The simple inherit folly: but the prudent are crowned with knowledge.

19.text: The evil bow before the good; and the wicked at the gates of the righteous.

20.text: The poor is hated even of his own neighbour: but the rich hath many friends.

21.text: He that despiseth his neighbour sinneth: but he that hath pity on the poor, happy is he.

22.text: Do they not err that devise evil? but mercy and truth shall be to them that devise good.

23.text: In all labour there is profit: but the talk of the lips tendeth only to penury.

24.text: The crown of the wise is their riches: but the folly of fools is only folly.

25.text: A true witness delivereth souls: but he that uttereth lies causeth deceit.

26.text: In the fear of the LORD is strong confidence: and his children shall have a place of refuge.

27.text: The fear of the LORD is a fountain of life, to depart from the snares of death.

28.text: In the multitude of people is the king’s glory: but in the want of people is the destruction of the prince.

29.text: He that is slow to anger is of great understanding: but he that is hasty of spirit exalteth folly.

30.text: A sound heart is the life of the flesh: but envy is the rottenness of the bones.

31.text: He that oppresseth the poor reproacheth his Maker: but he that hath mercy on the needy honoureth him.

32.text: The wicked is thrust down in his evil-doing: but the righteous hath hope in his death.

33.text: Wisdom resteth in the heart of him that hath understanding: but that which is in the inward part of fools is made known.

34.text: Righteousness exalteth a nation: but sin is a reproach to any people.

35.text: The king’s favour is toward a servant that dealeth wisely: but his wrath shall be against him that causeth shame.
